intro: [WRONG START] Ribes sanguineum f. Brocklebankii, commonly known as the Brocklebank's redcurrant, is a hybrid form of the redcurrant plant native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It is characterized by its vibrant red, edible berries that ripen in late summer. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with dark green, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its showy flowers and colorful fruit, which also attract birds and other wildlife.
